text:
The problem with the codepen is that the form is loaded as an iframe. When the form is in an iframe the styling and javascript  comes from HubSpot.
On the form you have an option to embed the form unstyled, and that allows you to add your site specific styling and javascript.
I'd also mention that you may need to trigger a change. something like `$('form input[type="text"]').val(school).trigger('change')` is how I do it for a text input.
Aha! I think this might do it as I remember something from the dev docs that mentioned it. Thanks all! Iâ€™ll keep you apprised :sunglasses:
Hi <@U25PYL3Q8> I tried doing this :  var elementExists = $( 'input[type=radio][name=choose_your_area_of_interest]' ).filter(':checked').val().trigger('change');
but it borked.
It seems that the elements aren't visible to the script
Used that code to see if the radio button exists, computer said no - even though (presumably) the form must have rendered b/c I'm hitting 'submit'
are you running these on window load?
no, just on 'submit' of form
So, the entire on submit needs to be wrapped inside a window load
This is because the form doesn't really exist until after window.load because of the way it is brought in
so
Oh, weird - why doesn't HS just include that in the embed code?
Oh I see what you are doing
timeout
can you paste in the entire amount of code in here?
Sure, hang on
Sorry should have removed commented out code
you have a preview link I can see?
<https://apply.joinstepladder.com/drawn?hs_preview=PqLEVUPs-23278127129>
do you mind if I submit the form? If so is there a certain email address I should use?
just use something with test in the title :slightly_smiling_face:
so if I open up the console and type in `$("input[type=radio][name=choose_your_area_of_interest]").filter(":checked").val();`
it just says undefined
so next-- `$("input[type=radio][name=choose_your_area_of_interest]").length`
checking to see if the item is in the page, and it returns 0 for length
yes, that's the problem - when you get 'undefined' for a .val it means the array is empty. When I use a script to test if the radio button even exists, it says it doesn't't :disappointed:
`$('input[name="choose_your_area_of_interest"]').length`
so then I do that just to make sure, because your formawtting is a bit differnet than I would use, so that returns 0 as well
:sob:
so then I search through the code
and you can see it is placing your form inside an iframe
that is a setting you need to change in the form... give me a minute and I'll see if I can find it
oooooo
Interesting. I never would have thought of that!
so, you don't have access to the iframe and the content inside the iframe. That would allow you to modify other sites content
which would generally be a no no
So what do you do, when you need to record the clicks from an iframe on HubSpot?
So go into your form and edit it, click on the style & preview tab
Select the first option set as raw html form
then save/publish the form
No way. That's it?! You're a genius. I will need to post a tutorial for this as thanks
LOL
I've been breaking stuff on HubSpot for many years
It had to be something fundamental like this as I had tried SO MANY codes :joy:
I've done many cussing out over that. All of a sudden one day there was a slider that you needed to turn on and I had no idea it existed
hahaha. Classic stuff! And there's just not enough online tutorial and FAQ wise for HS yet so google is a mysteryland
very true. Most of this information is tied up in the brains of a few people
If you have a patreon let me know, if not perhaps you should start one!
Interesting.. never thought of it
...:moneybag:
It's working! Except the radio buttons are...invisible? Labels are there...
`input[type=radio], input[type=checkbox]`
so
<https://apply.joinstepladder.com/drawn?hs_preview=PqLEVUPs-23278127129&hsDebug=ttrue>
ADD `&hsDebug=true` to the end of your url
that isn't working nevermind
yes it does lol
so right there you can see line 139 of that styleshee is where you are displaying none on it
odd
`HusbpotStyleSheetforSL.css`
I guess they showed before coz they were in an iframe :face_with_raised_eyebrow:
Not sure why I hid them. I'm a nob.
exactly
LOL
I don't know why you hid them either
I generally see people hiding the error messages
not the inputs hahahaha
Thank you so much - I think the mystery has now been solved. <Insert point emoji>
oh well, we all mess up
:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
hahahaha
point = Poirot.   ffs.
